vsParam:
Wow!? I heard that Sterk is training with the Guard,
but I didn't expect his opponent would be Tandrion!?

Wow! Your attack is powerful!
I'd be in danger if I resisted that from the front!

Hmm, you are great, too!
You saw me through, huh?

Both your moves and speed are excellent!
But... take this!

Sterk and Captain... What a wonderful duel!
Is that... the real swordsmanship!

I get to watch such a spectacular scene.
I feel so happy ah ah ah ah!

Leave this hot-blooded moron alone...
But I'm surprised that Tandrion isn't pulling any punches this time.

After all, his opponent is Sterk, who's a real master.
Even Tandrion must take him very seriously!
His opponent is very handsome, too!

It's like they are performing a sword dance!
Ah... So beautiful!

Oh, the crowd is getting bigger.
That's it. Let's call it a day!

Uh!?
You have to finish the competition, Tandrion!

We'll leave it till next time.
I can't focus in front of such a big crowd!

Right, Sterk!
Please give Cresson some guidance in actual combat.

Let's name it Sterkish Training!
I gotta go, I'll leave Cresson to you~

"Sterkish Training"?
Wait, Tandrion, our competition isn't—

Got it, Captain!
I'll learn hard from Sterk!

So, sorry to trouble you, Sterk!
Please teach me the swordsmanship of Arland!

Ah, hmm... I'll teach you during
our battle against monsters.

Oh oh, great—! Now the monsters are no match for me,
no matter it's 100 or 200 of them!

Ah... They are too excited.
It makes me worried to see them go hunting like that...

Yeah. Let's tag along, [px].
Just in case we need to stop him... I mean Cresson.

There's a suitable monster.
Make it your opponent.

But remember, this is actual combat. Carelessness will
make you get hurt. Stay sharp till the very end of the battle.

Uh, OK!
Hmm... please give me advice!

Ha! Great, the battle's over.
You've done a good job, Cresson.

Uh, thank you for your compliment!
I remembered all your moves!

Your sword is fast and powerful, and each move is lethal...
I'll train harder so that I could be like you one day!

Ha-ha, look how excited Cresson is.
He's so happy...

You guys provided reliable assistance for him.
Good teamwork.

Hee hee, thank you!
Your compliment means a lot to us!
Yes. But... hmm, this is really a tiring job for you. Thank you.

Tandrion did things without thinking,
and saddled you with this training he casually mentioned...
Hmm, you are not angry, are you?
I'll give you a shoulder massage later!

Angry? No, not at all.
I believe he knows what he's doing.

You are going to reward me?
I appreciate your kindness.

Uh... The serious Sterk and the mischievous Tandrion,
I thought you should be incompatible as fire and water...

No... Through our mock fight just now,
I have no doubt about his strength and power.

And, although he purposely acts cheeky or mischievous, he is
actually very concerned about Cresson and other guards.

Otherwise, Cresson's swordsmanship wouldn't be this
good if he only relies on his own efforts.

Uh... R-really, Sterk!?
Your evaluation of me is so... high... I am so honored!!

Though the training seems casual,
his men still put their hearts and souls into it.

Some knights in Arland would skip sword training.
In comparison, the Guard is way better.

No... I'm sorry. Please forget what I said.
Alright, let's go back to the Academy.

Ah, okay~! Hmm... Maybe Arland
is a very peaceful country, huh?
